title: Quran
summary: The Quran (/kʊˈrɑːn/, kor-AHN;[lower-roman 1] Arabic: القرآن‎, romanized: al-Qurʼān, lit. 'the recitation', Arabic pronunciation: [alqurˈʔaːn][lower-roman 2]), also romanized Qur'an or Koran,[lower-roman 3] is the central religious text of Islam, believed by Muslims to be a revelation from God (Allah).[11] It is widely regarded as the finest work in classical Arabic literature.[12][13][lower-roman 4][lower-roman 5] It is organized in 114 chapters (surah (سور‎; singular: سورة‎, sūrah)), which consist of verses (āyāt (آيات‎; singular: آية‎, āyah)).
